revised_title: Early Life Tables and the Development of Medical Statistics
tldr: This article discusses the early methods used to create life tables and the development of medical statistics. It highlights the work of Sir William Petty, Sir Thomas Browne, and others who contributed to the field. The author also explores the interaction between particular and general problems in the history of science and how it led to the development of mathematical statistics.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
